title: Musk is ruining Tesla for these French owners
summary: An unwitting political symbol, the fast, eco-friendly and progressive car has become an encumbrance on wheels since the company's boss entered US politics.

title: French voters' mistrust of politics aggravated since snap elections, gap with neighbors widens
summary: France appears to be an island of pessimism, according to a political confidence barometer published by Cevipof on February 11, while Germany, Italy and the Netherlands, which are also going through turbulent times, have kept up a much higher level of confidence.

title: US defense chief suggests Ukraine should abandon hope of winning all territory back from Russia
summary: US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth's warning resembles Moscow's vision, as Russian President Vladimir Putin has declared that any peace deal must ensure that Ukraine gives up its NATO ambitions and withdraws its troops from the four regions that Russia annexed in September 2022 but never fully captured.

title: Judge clears way for Trump’s plan to downsize federal workforce with deferred resignation program
summary: US President Donald Trump wants to use financial incentives to encourage government employees to quit. According to the White House, tens of thousands of workers have taken the government up on its offer.

title: Former Israeli hostages start revealing detention conditions in Gaza
summary: Whether as a sign of defiance toward the government or out of despair at not seeing the return of those still held in the Gaza Strip, the hostages freed since January 19 and their relatives are gradually speaking out to the press.

title: At Paris summit, the US charges against AI 'censorship'
summary: US Vice President JD Vance warned against 'excessive regulation' of AI, particularly in the European Union. In response, Emmanuel Macron and Ursula von der Leyen argued for a 'third way,' while touting their investments in the sector.

title: FEMA yanks back $80 million that New York City meant to cover hotel costs for migrants
summary: New York City Comptroller Brad Lander said the money was discovered to be missing overnight and Lander said no one in his office had been aware that the federal government had access to the city's bank account. Meanwhile, Trump's administration filed a lawsuit against New York on Wednesday accusing the Democratic-ruled state of hindering federal efforts to crack down on undocumented migrants.

title: UK PM vows 'new towns' in England to alleviate housing crunch
summary: The government said in a press release that it was considering more than 100 sites across England for the new urban areas. The towns will be 'well-designed, beautiful communities with affordable housing, GP [doctor's] surgeries, schools and public transport where people will want to live.'

title: Trump says Ukraine talks to start 'immediately' after Putin call
summary: US President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin spoke by phone on Wednesday. Trump described the call as 'lengthy and highly productive,' and the Kremlin said the leaders had agreed that the 'time has come to work together.'

title: War in Ukraine: Uncertainty over fate of North Korean soldiers deployed to Kursk
summary: The 10,000 North Koreans sent to this Russian region to fight alongside the Russians withdrew from the area in mid-January after suffering heavy losses.

title: US releases Russian crypto kingpin Vinnik in prisoner exchange, official says
summary: An official said Alexander Vinnik, who had been extradited from Greece to the US in 2022, was being released as part of the exchange with Russia that saw American teacher Marc Fogel freed on Tuesday.

title: Hungary's Orban says far-right AfD is 'future of Germany'
summary: The nationalist leader hosted Alternative for Germany's co-leader Alice Weidel on Wednesday.

title: Tulsi Gabbard confirmed as new US spy chief
summary: Gabbard – appointed to be director of national intelligence – has faced questions over her 2017 meeting with now-deposed Syrian leader Bashar al-Assad and her peddling of Kremlin propaganda, particularly false conspiracy theories about the Ukraine war.

title: Roberto Saviano, outspoken opponent of organized crime and Meloni: 'There is definitely a mafia mentality in Italy'
summary: Forced to live under police protection, the writer has become one of the main intellectual opponents of the Italian prime minister and her far-right government.

title: Macron hosts Modi with geopolitical 'independence' in mind
summary: French President Emmanuel Macron and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited southern France with a packed schedule on Wednesday, February 12, fostering a relationship that Paris sees as an alternative to great power rivalries.

title: EU examines future of its outdated budget
summary: The European Commission wants a more flexible financial framework to meet the challenges, including green technologies, border security and defense, facing the 27 member states.

title: Russia rejects swapping occupied territory with Ukraine after Zelensky suggestion
summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky floated the idea of swapping territory as part of a peace deal ahead of a meeting in Munich with US Vice President JD Vance.

title: 'I discovered pornography when I was 14. Very early, I think'
summary: Little informed about sexuality, Assia, 18, who lives near Paris, discovered pornography with her first boyfriend. Exposure to these images and practices left their mark on her.

title: In Haiti, childhood stolen by gangs and impunity
summary: Armed groups operating in Port-au-Prince have 'undermined a myriad of children's human rights,' according to a report by Amnesty International. According to the UN, sexual violence against minors increased tenfold in 2024, and gang recruitment of children rose by 70%.

title: The big breakdown in home equipment sales
summary: In 2024, virtually all housing equipment goods saw their sales plummet. The furniture market fell by 5.1% and major household appliances by 3.9%. Only small appliances are doing well, thanks to the success of the air fryer.
